column2: IDAHO PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 2. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column8: that a reversible lane starts.

column2: 3. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 4. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column6: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: A road crosses the main highway ahead.

column2: 7. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column8: regardless of your direction.

column2: 8. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column6: look into the left side mirror.
column8: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 9. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 11. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 12. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: regulatory signs.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic turn right

column2: 14. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 15. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column8: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column10: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.

column2: 16. Drivers should use the horn:
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column8: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column8: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 18. An emergency vehicle approaches from behind with lights flashing. Drivers should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution.
column6: turn on the headlights and continue to drive forward.
column8: immediately pull over to the edge of the road and stop.
column10: speed up to maintain a safe distance between them and the emergency vehicle.

column2: 19. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column8: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed

column2: 31. If you stop along the road at night:
column8: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column10: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 32. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 33. On a road with two or more lanes in the same direction, you approach an emergency vehicle that is stopped with its warning lights on. You must:
column4: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: maintain your current speed and stay in your lane.
column8: slow down. If possible, change lanes.
column10: pass the emergency vehicle as quickly as possible.

column2: 34. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column8: only on the left and right side

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column8: No Turning

column2: 36. Smoking while driving:
column8: does not affect driving abilities.

column2: 37. What should you do when another car is trying to pass you?
column4: After checking for oncoming traffic, adjust your speed to allow safe passing.
column6: pull off the road to allow safe passing.
column8: yield the right-of-way to the other driver.

column2: 38. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 39. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column10: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 40. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: the road is narrower ahead.
